Package it.polimi.ingsw.View.User

Class GuiInitController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.View.User.GuiInitController
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
GuiBoardController
public class GuiInitController
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserInterface
GuiInitController is the Class that contains all the methods used for the implementation of the JavaFX gui for the first screens up until before the Board is created. This class also contains all the helpers needed for the GuiBoard class to work.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiInitController

      public GuiInitController​(Client client, ClientConnection clientConnection, ClientExceptionHandler clientExceptionHandler)
      Constructor for the GuiInitController class
      Parameters:
      client - The client class, which has the references to the UserInteraction class, hence the Game information
      clientConnection - The clientConnection class, used for handling outbound and inbound messages
      clientExceptionHandler - The clientExceptionHandler, which handles some verification of the input and prompts the errors for the gui

    • finalScore

      public void finalScore() throws java.net.URISyntaxException, java.io.IOException
      The popup for notifying the user of the end of the game and its status as a player (Winner/Loser)
      Throws:
      java.net.URISyntaxException - If the music path is formatted badly
      java.io.IOException - If there are problems reading the FXML

    • nameValidation

      public void nameValidation() throws java.lang.Exception
      Gets the name from the name's Text Field and calls the nameValidator in ClientExceptionHandler it for validation. If validation is successful the name is sent
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If there are problems with the connection

    • playerNumberValidation

      public void playerNumberValidation() throws java.io.IOException
      Validates the number of players to be sent to the server and then sends them to the server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there are problems with the connection

    • leaderCardCheck

      protected void leaderCardCheck()
      Checks that the user has picked two leader cards and enables the cards to be pickable into a checkbox. If the user has picked 2 leader Cards those are sent to the server, otherwise the user is informed of the error

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(int cardId, boolean front)
      By giving a card id it returns the corresponding Image
      Parameters:
      cardId - the card id to show
      front - true to get the front of the card, if false it returns the back of the card
      Returns:
      an image of the card, null if the cardId is 0 or negative. If it's a new Leader Card it's always shown the image of the 64th card

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(Marble marble)
      By giving a Marble it returns the corresponding image
      Parameters:
      marble - the marble to show
      Returns:
      the image of the marble

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(ResourceType resourceType)
      By giving a Resource it returns the corresponding image
      Parameters:
      resourceType - the resource to show
      Returns:
      the image of the resource OR null if the resource type is null

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(SoloActionToken soloActionToken)

      Returns:
      the image of the token

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(boolean inkwell)
      By giving a boolean it returns either the inkwell or the back of a token if the game is in singleplayer mode
      Parameters:
      inkwell - Inkwell picture if true, solo token back if fase
      Returns:
      the image of the inkwell/token

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(Player player)
      By giving a Player it returns its faith marker: a green one if it's from the player, a red one if it is from other players and a BlackCross token if its Lorenzo's
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the token image from
      Returns:
      The token image

    • getImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getImage​(PopeTile popeTile, int tileNumber)
      By giving a Pope tile it returns the corresponding image to visualize its activation
      Parameters:
      popeTile - The pope tile to get the image from
      tileNumber - The pope tile number to get the resource from [2-4]
      Returns:
      The pope image

    • initial

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> initial()
      Used to get the Server Address and Server Port as input from the player.
      Specified by:
      initial in interface UserInterface
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of object. - First element in the ArrayList -> String containing server address. - Second element in the ArrayList -> Integer containing server port.
